Percentiles

Source: R/ds-describe.R
ds_percentiles.Rd

Returns the percentiles

ds_percentiles(data, ..., decimals = 2)

Arguments

data

A data.frame or tibble.
...

Column(s) in data.
decimals

An option to specify the exact number of decimal places to use. The default number of decimal places is 2.

Examples


# single column
ds_percentiles(mtcarz, mpg)

#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   var       n   min per_1 per_5 per_10    q1 median    q3 per_90 per_95 per_99
#>   <chr> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 mpg      32  10.4  10.4  12.0   14.3  15.4   19.2  22.8   30.1   31.3   33.4
#> # ... with 1 more variable: max <dbl>

# multiple columns
ds_percentiles(mtcarz, mpg, disp)

#> # A tibble: 2 x 13
#>   var       n   min per_1 per_5 per_10    q1 median    q3 per_90 per_95 per_99
#>   <chr> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 disp     32  71.1  72.5  77.4   80.6 121.   196.  326    396.   449    468. 
#> 2 mpg      32  10.4  10.4  12.0   14.3  15.4   19.2  22.8   30.1   31.3   33.4
#> # ... with 1 more variable: max <dbl>

# all columns
ds_percentiles(mtcarz)

#> # A tibble: 6 x 13
#>   var       n   min per_1 per_5 per_10     q1 median     q3 per_90 per_95 per_99
#>   <chr> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 disp     32 71.1  72.5  77.4   80.6  121.   196.   326    396.   449    468.  
#> 2 drat     32  2.76  2.76  2.85   3.01   3.08   3.70   3.92   4.21   4.31   4.78
#> 3 hp       32 52    55.1  63.6   66     96.5  123    180    244.   254.   313.  
#> 4 mpg      32 10.4  10.4  12.0   14.3   15.4   19.2   22.8   30.1   31.3   33.4 
#> 5 qsec     32 14.5  14.5  15.0   15.5   16.9   17.7   18.9   20.0   20.1   22.1 
#> 6 wt       32  1.51  1.54  1.74   1.96   2.58   3.32   3.61   4.05   5.29   5.40
#> # ... with 1 more variable: max <dbl>

# vector
ds_percentiles(mtcarz$mpg)

#>    var  n  min per_1 per_5 per_10    q1 median   q3 per_90 per_95 per_99  max
#> 1% mpg 32 10.4  10.4    12  14.34 15.43   19.2 22.8  30.09   31.3  33.44 33.9

# vectors of different length
disp <- mtcarz$disp[1:10]
ds_percentiles(mtcarz$mpg, disp)

#>          var  n   min  per_1  per_5 per_10     q1 median     q3 per_90 per_95
#> 1 mtcarz$mpg 32  10.4  10.40  12.00  14.34  15.43   19.2  22.80  30.09   31.3
#> 2       disp 10 108.0 110.95 122.76 137.52 150.02  163.8 249.75 360.00  360.0
#>   per_99   max
#> 1  33.44  33.9
#> 2 360.00 360.0

# decimal places
ds_percentiles(mtcarz, disp, hp, decimals = 3)

#> # A tibble: 2 x 13
#>   var       n   min per_1 per_5 per_10    q1 median    q3 per_90 per_95 per_99
#>   <chr> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 disp     32  71.1  72.5  77.4   80.6 121.    196.   326   396.   449    468.
#> 2 hp       32  52    55.1  63.6   66    96.5   123    180   244.   254.   313.
#> # ... with 1 more variable: max <dbl>
